messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a house with 21 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7. Room 12 is connected to rooms 13, 14, 8, 9, 10, and 11. Room 21 is connected to rooms 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, and 20. Room 6 is connected to rooms 7, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Room 3 is connected to rooms 4, 5, 7, and 2. Room 14 is connected to rooms 4, 8, 9, 10, and 11. Room 10 is connected to rooms 11, 13, 8, and 9. Room 19 is connected to rooms 20, 15, 16, 17, and 18. Room 5 is connected to rooms 7, 2, and 16. Room 8 is connected to rooms 9, 11, and 13. Room 9 is connected to rooms 11 and 13. Room 18 is connected to rooms 20, 15, 16, and 17. Room 7 is connected to rooms 2, and 4. Room 11 is connected to rooms 13. Room 20 is connected to rooms 15, 16, and 17. Room 2 is connected to room 4. Room 13 is connected to room 17. Room 17 is connected to rooms 15. Room 15 is connected to room 16. From room 5 what is the shortest path to room 20? Starting from room 5, please list the room numbers in order, including 5, separated by commas.

To find the shortest path from room 5 to room 20, we can use Dijkstra's algorithm. Here are the steps:

1. Create a table with all the rooms and their distances from room 5. Set the distance of room 5 to 0, and the distance of all other rooms to infinity. Also, create a list of unvisited rooms, starting with all the rooms.

| Room | Distance | Visited? |
|------|----------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |          |
| 2    | 1        |          |
| 3    | 1        |          |
| 4    | 1        |          |
| 5    | 0        |          |
| 6    | ∞        |          |
| 7    | 1        |          |
| 8    | ∞        |          |
| 9    | ∞        |          |
| 10   | ∞        |          |
| 11   | ∞        |          |
| 12   | ∞        |          |
| 13   | ∞        |          |
| 14   | ∞        |          |
| 15   | 2        |          |
| 16   | 2        |          |
| 17   | 3        |          |
| 18   | 3        |          |
| 19   | ∞        |          |
| 20   | 3        |          |
| 21   | ∞        |          |

2. Mark room 5 as visited.

| Room | Distance | Visited? |
|------|----------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |          |
| 2    | 1        |          |
| 3    | 1        |          |
| 4    | 1        |          |
| 5    | 0        |    Yes   |
| 6    | ∞        |          |
| 7    | 1        |          |
| 8    | ∞        |          |
| 9    | ∞        |          |
| 10   | ∞        |          |
| 11   | ∞        |          |
| 12   | ∞        |          |
| 13   | ∞        |          |
| 14   | ∞        |          |
| 15   | 2        |          |
| 16   | 2        |          |
| 17   | 3        |          |
| 18   | 3        |          |
| 19   | ∞        |          |
| 20   | 3        |          |
| 21   | ∞        |          |

3. For each of the rooms connected to room 5 (rooms 2, 4, 7, and 16), update their distances in the table. The new distance is the distance from room 5 to the connected room, plus the distance from the connected room to room 20. If this new distance is shorter than the current distance in the table, update the table.

| Room | Distance | Visited? |
|------|----------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |          |
| 2    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 3    | 1        |          |
| 4    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 5    | 0        |    Yes   |
| 6    | ∞        |          |
| 7    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 8    | ∞        |          |
| 9    | ∞        |          |
| 10   | ∞        |          |
| 11   | ∞        |          |
| 12   | ∞        |          |
| 13   | ∞        |          |
| 14   | ∞        |          |
| 15   | 2        |          |
| 16   | 2        |    Yes   |
| 17   | 3        |          |
| 18   | 3        |          |
| 19   | ∞        |          |
| 20   | 3        |          |
| 21   | ∞        |          |

4. Mark the room with the shortest distance from the table as visited. In this case, it is room 2.

| Room | Distance | Visited? |
|------|----------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |          |
| 2    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 3    | 1        |          |
| 4    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 5    | 0        |    Yes   |
| 6    | ∞        |          |
| 7    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 8    | ∞        |          |
| 9    | ∞        |          |
| 10   | ∞        |          |
| 11   | ∞        |          |
| 12   | ∞        |          |
| 13   | ∞        |          |
| 14   | ∞        |          |
| 15   | 2        |          |
| 16   | 2        |    Yes   |
| 17   | 3        |          |
| 18   | 3        |          |
| 19   | ∞        |          |
| 20   | 3        |          |
| 21   | ∞        |          |

5. For each of the rooms connected to the newly visited room (room 2), update their distances in the table. The new distance is the distance from room 5 to room 2, plus the distance from room 2 to the connected room, plus the distance from the connected room to room 20. If this new distance is shorter than the current distance in the table, update the table.

| Room | Distance | Visited? |
|------|----------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |          |
| 2    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 3    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 4    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 5    | 0        |    Yes   |
| 6    | ∞        |          |
| 7    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 8    | 2        |          |
| 9    | 2        |          |
| 10   | 2        |          |
| 11   | 2        |          |
| 12   | ∞        |          |
| 13   | 3        |          |
| 14   | 2        |          |
| 15   | 3        |          |
| 16   | 2        |    Yes   |
| 17   | 4        |          |
| 18   | 4        |          |
| 19   | 3        |          |
| 20   | 4        |          |
| 21   | ∞        |          |

6. Mark the room with the shortest distance from the table as visited. In this case, it is room 3.

| Room | Distance | Visited? |
|------|----------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |          |
| 2    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 3    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 4    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 5    | 0        |    Yes   |
| 6    | ∞        |          |
| 7    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 8    | 2        |          |
| 9    | 2        |          |
| 10   | 2        |          |
| 11   | 2        |          |
| 12   | ∞        |          |
| 13   | 3        |          |
| 14   | 2        |          |
| 15   | 3        |          |
| 16   | 2        |    Yes   |
| 17   | 4        |          |
| 18   | 4        |          |
| 19   | 3        |          |
| 20   | 4        |          |
| 21   | ∞        |          |

7. Repeat steps 5 and 6 until room 20 is marked as visited. The final table is:

| Room | Distance | Visited? |
|------|----------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |          |
| 2    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 3    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 4    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 5    | 0        |    Yes   |
| 6    | ∞        |          |
| 7    | 1        |    Yes   |
| 8    | 2        |    Yes   |
| 9    | 2        |          |
| 10   | 2        |          |
| 11   | 2        |          |
| 12   | ∞        |          |
| 13   | 3        |          |
| 14   | 2        |          |
| 15   | 3        |    Yes   |
|
